Detailed Description

Functions for SRIO initialization, configuration, and monitoring.

Revision
41586

Function Documentation

int __cvmx_helper_srio_enable ( int  xiface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Bringup and enable SRIO interface. After this call packet I/O should be fully functional. This is called with IPD enabled but PKO disabled.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to bring up
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
cvmx_helper_link_info_t __cvmx_helper_srio_link_get ( int  ipd_port  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Return the link state of an IPD/PKO port as returned by SRIO link status.

Parameters:
ipd_port IPD/PKO port to query
Returns:
Link state
int __cvmx_helper_srio_link_set ( int  ipd_port,
cvmx_helper_link_info_t  link_info 
)

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Configure an IPD/PKO port for the specified link state. This function does not influence auto negotiation at the PHY level. The passed link state must always match the link state returned by cvmx_helper_link_get(). It is normally best to use cvmx_helper_link_autoconf() instead.

Parameters:
ipd_port IPD/PKO port to configure
link_info The new link state
Returns:
Zero on success, negative on failure
int __cvmx_helper_srio_port ( int  xiface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Convert interface number to sRIO link number per SoC model.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to convert
Returns:
Srio link number
int __cvmx_helper_srio_probe ( int  xiface  ) 

Internal use function.

This function's parameters and processing may change in future SDKs.

Probe a SRIO interface and determine the number of ports connected to it. The SRIO interface should still be down after this call.

Parameters:
xiface Interface to probe
Returns:
Number of ports on the interface. Zero to disable.
